tasks.title: Setup Next.js Project with TypeScript, Tailwind CSS, and shadcn/ui
tasks.description: Initialize a new Next.js 15 project with TypeScript, Tailwind CSS, and shadcn/ui library for modern UI components.
tasks.details:
1. Create new Next.js project: `npx create-next-app@latest cookie-course --typescript --tailwind --app --eslint`
2. Configure Tailwind CSS with custom CSS variables in `app/globals.css`
3. Install and configure shadcn/ui: `npx shadcn@latest init`
4. Install essential shadcn/ui components: `npx shadcn@latest add button card table form input label textarea`
5. Setup basic folder structure following Next.js App Router conventions
6. Configure TypeScript with strict mode
7. Test the setup by running `npm run dev`
tasks.testStrategy: Verify project runs successfully on localhost:3000 with shadcn/ui components properly styled

tasks.title: Integrate Azure Cosmos DB Connection Layer
tasks.description: Set up the connection layer to Azure Cosmos DB using @azure/cosmos package for data persistence.
tasks.details:
1. ✅ Install Azure Cosmos DB SDK: `npm install @azure/cosmos`
2. ✅ Create `lib/cosmos.ts` with connection configuration, including:
   - TypeScript interfaces for Participant, Lesson, Enrollment
   - CosmosService class with connection management
   - Full CRUD operations for all entity types
   - Error handling and connection pooling
   - Singleton pattern for service instance
3. ✅ Create `lib/cosmos-test.ts` with testing utilities:
   - Connection testing function
   - CRUD operations testing
   - Sample data creation
   - Environment variable checking
4. ✅ Setup environment variables for Cosmos DB connection string and database name:
   - COSMOS_DB_ENDPOINT
   - COSMOS_DB_KEY
   - COSMOS_DB_DATABASE_ID=hillpointe
   - COSMOS_DB_PARTICIPANTS_CONTAINER=participants
   - COSMOS_DB_LESSONS_CONTAINER=lessons
5. ✅ Test connection with a simple query using the created testing utilities
6. ✅ Verify CRUD operations work with real database
7. ✅ Complete final integration testing
tasks.testStrategy:
1. ✅ Use `lib/cosmos-test.ts` to verify successful connection to Azure Cosmos DB
2. ✅ Test all CRUD operations for each entity type (Participant, Lesson, Enrollment)
3. ✅ Verify error handling works correctly
4. ✅ Ensure connection pooling is functioning as expected
5. ✅ Validate the singleton pattern implementation
6. ✅ Test soft delete functionality for participants
7. ✅ Verify automatic timestamps for lessons
8. ✅ Test utility methods (getParticipantFullName, getLessonWithEnrolledParticipants)
9. ✅ Validate payment tracking for enrollments
10. ✅ Confirm embedded enrollments structure in lessons container

tasks.title: Implement Participant Creation Flow with Form and POST Endpoint
tasks.description: Create a simple POST endpoint at /api/participants and a form component using shadcn/ui Form components with essential fields that submits to this endpoint.
tasks.details:
1. Install shadcn/ui form components: `npx shadcn@latest add form dialog button input label`
2. Create POST endpoint in `app/api/participants/route.ts` for creating participants
   - Implement GET and POST methods
   - Integrate with Cosmos DB service using `lib/cosmos.ts`
   - Add validation for fields (firstName, lastName, email, age, phone)
   - Implement error handling with appropriate HTTP status codes
   - Add email regex validation and age range validation (16-100)
3. Build participant creation form in `/components/participant-form.tsx`
   - Use shadcn/ui Form, Card, Input, Label, Textarea, and Button components
   - Create comprehensive form with sections: Basic Info, Dietary Info, Emergency Contact
   - Implement real-time form validation and error state management
   - Add success/error message display with proper styling
   - Implement form reset after successful submission
   - Add loading states during submission
4. Create participants table component in `/components/participants-table.tsx`
   - Use shadcn/ui Table, Card components with responsive design
   - Implement dynamic data fetching from the API endpoint
   - Add loading spinner and error handling with retry functionality
   - Display comprehensive participant data including all fields
   - Add status badges and formatted dates
   - Implement empty state handling with helpful messaging
5. Integrate components in home page `/app/page.tsx`
   - Convert to client component
   - Add participant management section with toggle form visibility
   - Implement refresh mechanism between form submission and table display
   - Update status cards to reflect implementation progress
   - Create responsive layout with max-width container
6. Configure environment variables for Cosmos DB connection:
   - COSMOS_DB_ENDPOINT
   - COSMOS_DB_KEY
   - COSMOS_DB_DATABASE_ID
   - COSMOS_DB_PARTICIPANTS_CONTAINER
   - COSMOS_DB_LESSONS_CONTAINER
tasks.testStrategy:
1. Test form submission creates new participant in Cosmos DB
2. Verify data displays correctly in table after creation
3. Confirm success/error messages shown appropriately
4. Test loading states and error handling functionality
5. Verify form validation prevents invalid submissions
6. Test responsive design across different screen sizes
7. Ensure proper error boundary handling
8. Verify environment variables are correctly configured for Cosmos DB connection
